Bugsmash.name: Bugsmash
desc: The event would be conducted in a Relay manner i.e.
each teammate should debug one after another.
Certain hindrances would be there to bring in more fun and to increase the difficulty.
The complexity would increase with the rounds

Rules: A team must contain 3 members.
Basic programming knowledge is required.
Discussion among participants will not be entertained. If found so, the team will be disqualified.
The winner is determined by the total points of each team.

Venue: Main Block - Software Engineering Lab, 3rd Floor

Codezilla.name: Codezilla
desc: Gear up for the ultimate coding battle! Codezilla, our flagship coding competition, will challenge your programming prowess and problem-solving skills. Compete against the best and showcase your coding finesse.

Rules: This is an individual event.
C, C++, Java and Python are allowed.
Any malpractice will not be entertained.
Judges decision will be final.

Rounds: It would be conducted in 2 rounds.
The first round would be Coding Quiz which will test your fundamental knowledge in programming.
Second round would be Code Commandos where you will face various kinds of obstacles which you would face throughout your Coding Journey.

Brain Squeezer.name: Brain Squeezer
desc: The questions will be displayed on a projector and the candidate has to answer the questions.
Certain hindrances will be given to add in fun and distract the contestants.

Rules: This is an individual event.
No of Rounds Will Be Decided Based On The Number Of Participants.
Candidates should not Involve in Any Kind of Malpractice. If Caught, then the Individual will be Completely Disqualified from the event.
The panel’s decision will be the final verdict.

UI/UX design.name: UI/UX design
desc: It is a single round event where the participants will be given a website to recreate the UI/UX. The participant whose design is closest to the website

Rules: This is an Individual event.
Participants have to bring their own laptops.
Designing should be done in Figma.
Design should not be done prior to the competition.
Participants should share their Figma URL.
Participants can use images of their own if necessary.
Participants should not use the pre-defined components from the external resource.

Paper Presentation.name: Paper Presentation
desc: Prepare to delve into the depths of cutting-edge research and groundbreaking ideas at the Paper Presentation event. Aspiring researchers and scholars, this is your chance to showcase your in-depth understanding of contemporary IT trends and present your findings to an esteemed audience.

Rules: Submit your research papers on topics and domains of recent technological trends.
A panel of experienced judges will evaluate the submissions based on innovation, relevance, and the depth of research.
Selected participants will have the opportunity to present their papers at Pinnacle and engage in insightful discussions with fellow researchers and attendees.
No vulnerability will be entertained.

Techtangle.name: Techtangle
desc: This would be a buzzer based event. A couple of pictures will be displayed on a projector.
The participants must identify a technical word by analyzing all the photos given as clues.

Rules: Each member of a team should mandatorily purchase a register pass for participating in the technical events.
Only the top scoring teams advance to the next round each time.
The decision of the jury will be final.

Rounds: There will be a total of 3 rounds - crosswords, connections, and dumb charades

Shark Tank.name: Shark Tank
desc: This event is to provide a platform for people to build their entrepreneurial journey by pitching and validating their ideas so that they can be implemented and get a chance to network with like-minded industry professionals

Rules: A team can have a maximum of 5 students.
Teams can bring their prototypes, if any. The team should take full responsibility for their prototypes. We are not responsible for any loss.
Create a pitch deck with your ideas and upload the following documents, including all the details contained in Guideline.
Each Team will have ten minutes to present their ideas
Copying an idea is strictly prohibited and disqualifies you.
The jury’s decision is final
The award will be based on the innovativeness and feasibility of the presented idea.

Rounds: First round : Ideas would be pitched to professors.
Second round (Shortlisted teams): Ideas would be pitched to investors.

Venue: PG Block - Web Technology Lab, 3rd Floor.

PS5.name: PS5
desc: It's a battleground for gamers seeking glory. Compete, conquer, and experience the thrill of next-gen gaming.

Rules: Each team will consist of two players.
The match structure will involve two halves, each lasting for a duration of 4 minutes.
Fixture arrangements will be based on the total number of entries received.
Respectful and sportsmanlike communication is expected.
Follow the tournament bracket and schedule as provided.
Timely reporting of match results is essential for the progression of the competition.

Audio Roulette.name: Audio Roulette
desc: This event is based on music, features two members in each team competing in various music based rounds. Join us for an event of musical euphoria where fun is the key note.

Rules: 2 participants per team
Teams will be eliminated based on their performance in each round.
Mobile phones are strictly prohibited during the event.
Judges decision will be final.
No vulnerability will be entertained.

Rounds: There are three interesting rounds namely:
Musical Connexions-connect the displayed images to find the song.
Shortlisted teams will navigate songs with unpredictable pauses,they will have to guess the upcoming lyric.
The final round is where one member wears headphones to act the song played while the other team member finds it.

Adapt tune.name: Adapt tune
desc: Show off your dance skills in this amazing platform where you sync your brains and legs to adapt yourself to the beats!

Rules: It’s a solo event.
Timing :- maximum 3 minutes.
Music will be continuously played in random.
Participants should dance according to the music played.
Judge’s decision will be final.

Shipwreck.name: Shipwreck
desc: Ahoy, brave souls! The Lost at Sea Challenge awaits! Picture this: a grand ship has found itself in treacherous waters, and it’s up to you sailors, a group of daring students, to navigate the stormy seas of debate and prove your worth to the enigmatic Captain.

Rules: It is an individual event.
Captain has a life jacket convince them to secure a spot on the lifeboat.
Imagination’s stranded; Prominent personalities will be assigned to students.
Prove your role’s survival importance. Surprises will test your adaptability and strategic thinking during the debate.
Awards for wit, eloquence, teamwork and a lifeboat seat for top survivors!

Vikings.name: Vikings
desc: Show of ur skills for the amazing carrom pool with the striker.

Rules: It is an individual event
Color Black coin contains 10 points
White coin contains 20 points
Red coin contains 50 points
Who scores maximum at the end of the game will be considered as the winner.
Every game is a knockout game
Participants should come on time.
Final decision will be made by the organisation.

Cini Quiz.name: Cini Quiz
desc: Embark on a cinematic journey like never before! The IT department proudly presents Pinnacle, our college symposium’s cinematic extravaganza. Join us for a cine quiz that transcends boundaries, featuring a diverse array of genres, languages, and styles, from commercial blockbusters to captivating art films.

Rules: A team can have maximum of two participants.
Individual participation also encouraged.
Embark on a trivia adventure with three captivating rounds! . The triumph of each round opens the gate to the next challenge! .
All participants must register prior to the event’s deadline.
All decisions made by tournament organizers are final.
1-2 members per team
Different rounds will there on anime content
Each rounds have elimination
Judges decision is final
No outside assistance

Single Jam.name: Single Jam
desc: There's always something to sing about and let's sing our hearts out. You have the chance to exhibit your singing skills. The participants will be judged on the song selection, voice quality, clarity, rhythm and their appeal to the audience.

Rules: It is an individual event.
Participants are not allowed to refer the lyrics.
Allotted time for round 1 is 2 minutes and round 2 is 1 minute.
Participants can bring their own karaoke tracks if needed.
Any form of vulgarity will lead to disqualification.
Decisions of the judges will be final.

Rounds: ROUND 1: Participants will take the stage alone and render a captivating performance for 2 minutes.
ROUND 2: Shortlisted performers deliver an impromptu performance based on their assigned genre for a minute.

Photography Contest.name: Photography Contest
desc: Theme:- REFLECTION

Rules: All photos must be original work, taken by the entrants.
Participants are allowed to submit only one photograph along with their name.
The winner will be contacted via the email address provided during entry.
Minimal Editing is allowed.
Vulgarity in any form is prohibited.
Judge’s Decision will be Final.
Exciting prizes awaiting.

Poster Making.name: Poster Making
desc: Feel free to imagine any theme for this contest!

Rules: Aspect Ratio : 4:3
Be original, avoiding clichés or overused formats.
Align your poster with the contest’s theme.
Adhere to content guidelines, avoiding inappropriate material.
Follow specified submission guidelines and Submit before the deadline.
Craft clear and creative posters.
Avoid copyrighted materials.
Please ensure your submission includes a brief description outlining the concept or idea behind your entry.

Meme Making.name: Meme Making
desc: Theme : CURRENT AFFAIRS

Rules: File Format : JPEG
Aspect Ratio : 4:3
Be original, avoiding cliches or overused formats.
Align your meme with the contest’s theme.
Adhere to content guidelines, avoiding inappropriate material.
Follow specified submission guidelines and Submit before the deadline.
Craft clear and creative memes.
Avoid copyrighted materials.

Valorant.name: Valorant
desc: Gear up and get ready for an adrenaline-fueled battle in the virtual arena! Calling all Valorant enthusiasts to showcase their skills and strategic prowess in our electrifying online event.

Rules: Team Formation: Teams can consist of a minimum of 5 players and a maximum of 7 players. Solo participants are also welcome to join and will be assigned to teams as needed.
Registration: All participants must register prior to the event’s deadline. Late registrations will not be accepted.
Match Reporting: Teams are responsible for reporting matches and in a timely manner to tournament organizers.
Fair Play: Cheating, exploiting bugs, or any form of unfair advantage will result in immediate disqualification.
Behavior: Participants are expected to maintain respectful behavior towards opponents and organizers.
Finality: All decisions made by tournament organizers are final and binding.

Who’s got talent.name: Who’s got talent
desc: It is a 1-minute virtual event highlighting the diverse talents of students. In this dynamic platform, participants present their unique skills, from music , dance and acting. The event adds an entertaining and engaging dimension to the symposium, allowing students to express their creativity and contribute to the vibrant atmosphere of the academic gathering.

Rules: Eligibility: Participants must be currently enrolled college students.
Time Limit: Performances are strictly limited to 1 minute.
Solo or Group Acts: Participants can perform individually or in groups, but the time limit remains 1 minute regardless.
Judging Criteria: Performances will be evaluated based on creativity, skill, entertainment value, and overall impact within the 1-minute timeframe.
Submission Deadline: Participants must submit their entries by the specified deadline to be considered for the talent show.
winner: winners are selected based on the performance and likes which will be posted on our instagram page.

Logo Creation.name: Logo Creation
desc: Feel free to imagine any theme for this contest !

Rules: Aspect ratio : 1:1
Craft an original logo, avoiding plagiarism.
The inclusion of any form of vulgarity in the logo design is strictly prohibited and will not be considered for the competition.
Align your logo with the theme or specified requirements.
Ensure clarity, especially when resized.
Design for scalability in various applications.
Be creative and have fun!

desc: A 4's football match of duration 3 mins per half where any team can participate with 2 rolling substitutes and the fixtures will be based on the number of teams registered.

Rules: Team length-4+1(rolling substitutes)
Time : 3-3
The referee’s decision is final
Refund of the registration fee will not be entertained strictly
Fixtures based on number of entries.
The organizing committee has full authority to revise the rules of the game

Registration: click here to register

desc: description

Rules: The rules

Registration: click here to register
